meanings.definition: A mechanical device used for hoisting or hauling.
meanings.sent1: The sailors used the winches to lift heavy crates onto the ship.
meanings.sent2: The winches on the construction site helped raise the steel beams.
meanings.sent3: The winches at the port had a race to see which could lift the most weight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the winch that pulled her through the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The winches groaned under the weight of the massive anchor.

meanings.definition: To hoist or haul using a winch.
meanings.sent1: They winched the car out of the ditch with a strong cable.
meanings.sent2: The workers winched the supplies up to the top floor of the building.
meanings.sent3: He winches up his pants every time he needs to climb a tree.
meanings.sent4: She winches up her courage before making the big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The team winches together to pull the boat closer to the shore.
